title: Sectional Mock 2 - English
instruction: In each of the questions below, a sentence has been broken into four parts with one word highlighted in bold in each fragment. From the given options, identify the word which expresses a meaning opposite to the given sentence, with the highlighted word replaced by a word of the opposite meaning.

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the SECOND statement after rearrangement?
options: A
B
C
F
E

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the FOURTH statement after rearrangement?
options: A
B
C
D
F

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the THIRD statement after rearrangement?
options: A
B
F
D
E

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the FIRST statement after rearrangement?
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the SIXTH statement after rearrangement?
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: Which of the following should be the FIFTH statement after rearrangement?
options: F
A
C
B
D

quiz.text: Choose the option that does not fit into the theme of the passage.
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: Choose the option that does not fit into the theme of the passage.
options: A
B
C
D

quiz.text: Choose the option that does not fit into the theme of the passage.
options: A

options: A

quiz.text: Choose the option that does not fit into the theme of the passage.
options: A
B
C
D

quiz.text: We will start the game “when we will get a green signal” from our technical team.
options: when we will be getting a green signal
when we get a green signal
then we will get a green signal
then we get a green signal
No improvement required

quiz.text: Malnutrition “carries on thousands of” children across the globe every year.
options: carries on thousands off
carries off thousands of
carries off thousands off
carry on thousands of
No improvement required

quiz.text: India has “already breaking the backbone of” GST implementation but there is still a long way to go.
options: already broken the backbone of
already broke the backbone of
already broken the back of

already broke the back of

E
No improvement required

quiz.text: Which of the following can be inferred from the given passage? I. Childhood memories always stay strong.II. Feeling of love towards someone is based on our current evaluation of that person.III. Emotions can be erased through technology- based therapy.
options: Only I
Only II
Only III
Both I and II
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following is false in context of the passage?
options: Effects of writing prompts were long-lasting.
current evaluations of people can be lowered if we choose to focus on their negative aspects.
The researcher Lawrence Patihis was from University of Southern Mississippi.
Options B and C
All are true

quiz.text: Which among the following is true as per the context of the passage?
options: Current feelings or emotions towards someone are more important than those of the past.
Love towards mother stays forever, no matter what.
Instances of success in life change our childhood memories of emotion towards someone.
Both A and C
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following can be the most appropriate title for the passage?
options: Love fades with time
Our current thinking can sway our memories of love
Childhood memories are always stronger than those of present
People, memories and perception
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is an antonym of the word ‘malleable’ as given in bold in the context of the passage?
options: palpable
skirmish
pliable
intractable
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is the best suited synonym for “generosity” as used in the passage?
options: munificence
abundance
sanity
truthfulness
meagre

quiz.text: Delhi and Mumbai are ‘tinderbox’ cities and therefore must strengthen their respective fire and safety regulations.
options: Full of inflammable waste
extremely crowded
dangerously uncontrollable
readily ignited
none of the above

quiz.text: The company tried to ‘keep a lid’ on the lawsuit but word got out to the media.
options: control
confirm
recover
defeat
none of the above

quiz.text: Whether the temperature rise was mainly due to the greenhouse effect was ‘a moot point’.
options: certain
scheme
regular
disputed
None of the above

quiz.text: When the new intern walked in dressed casually in jeans, there were a lot of ‘raised eyebrows.’
options: regret
enthusiasm
disapproval
questions
None of the above

quiz.text: The customer ‘gave a mouthful’ when asked the reason for his dissatisfaction.
options: angry
verbose
succinct
loud
None of the above

quiz.text: The DEARTH of water (A)/ has RESULTED into (B)/ MEDIOCRE production in (C)/ SOME regions of Rajasthan. (D)
options: A- abundance
B- developed
C- average
D- a few
All of the above

quiz.text: The government REVEALED that (A)/ it had INITIATED a move (B)/ to AMEND the (C)/ RTI Act two years AGO. (D)
options: A- disclosed
B- consummated
C- modify
D- before
All of the above

quiz.text: The RBI will do EVERYTHING (A)/ to ENSURE that (B)/ rupee does not DEPRECIATE (C)/ to the UNREASONABLE levels. (D)
options: A- nothing
B- gainsay
C- leap
D- legitimate
all of the above

quiz.text: Shah LAMBASTED Congress (A)/ STATING that Congress is (B)/ RESISTING the move to (C)/ SAFEGUARD its vote-bank. (D)
options: A- condemned
B- uttering
C- heeding
D- secure
All of the above

quiz.text: The upper castes' PROTEST (A)/ over the RECENT amendment (B)/ in SC/ST Act has DRAWN (C)/ lines of WORRY on BJP's forehead. (D)
options: A- acquiescence
B- latest
C- exerted
D- anxiety
All of the above
